page.title: 18LAW & ORDER_COMMUNITY POLICE
page.content: The Tiverton area has as much{crime per head as the cities of Exeter and Plymouth. The{police force}consists of 30 male and 3 female officers and 22 'special' constables. They work in 8 hour shifts. They{need help from the {community}because crime can be prevented and discovered much better if everybody co-operates. The police have a{Schools and {Community Liaison Officer}who tries to get people to support them. He visits schools, gives tours of the Police Station, including the 3 cells, and talks to groups about the work of the police. After our visit to the Police Station we took a{vote}about whether we liked and trusted our police force. 26 children did trust the police and 3 did not.
